imgs.text: Bounty II yawl photo on sailboatdata.com

name: BOUNTY II
notes:
Rhodes Design #658.
Based on the earlier RHODES 29, the BOUNTY II was one of the first production auxiliary sailboats of this size built in fiberglass. The design was commissioned by the builder specifically for the newly touted fiberglass construction methods. (William Garden, an employee with Rhodes at the time was said to have done the final plans.)
The original version also had a fiberglass mast. 
A few of this design (12?) were finished by Palmer Johnson Yachts. The molds were later acquired and modified by Pearson Yachts (at the direction of the Rhodes firm) to produce the RHODES 41.
